newsitem.title: USA: Carson sees Q1 earnings hurt by high ad spending.
newsitem.headline: Carson sees Q1 earnings hurt by high ad spending.

text.p: Carson Inc said it expects first quarter earnings to be affected by high advertising expenses and infrastructure investments.
It declined to provide specific earnings forecasts.
Last year's first quarter results were not immediately available. Carson launched its initial public offering in October.

Separately, Carson said it had acquired the complete Let's Jam product line and trademarks in a cash deal valued at $5.6 million. The deal is expected to be immediately accretive to earnings, it said.
In 1996, Let's Jam products generated about $5.8 million in net revenues.
Carson was off 3-1/4 to 8-1/8 at midday.
